info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jackson, Madison, northeastern Swain, Haywood, western Buncombe and northwestern Yancey Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Greeneville Tennessee to 15 miles south of Newport to 8 miles southwest of Gatlinburg. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sylva, Waynesville, Burnsville, Marshall, Asheville, Cherokee, Woodfin and Canton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
